duties_responsibilities.duty: Develop and implement the vision and strategy for the supply chain function at the plant level.
Plan, organize, and direct production planning, material management, procurement, sterilization, warehousing, and logistics/distribution functions for the plant.
Define goals and objectives, establish priorities, and provide oversight to ensure the plant meets its service level objectives and operates efficiently.
Lead the monthly S&OP process and issue the Master Production Schedules.
Run Material Requirement Planning and procure materials, products, and services for production and site activities.
Manage inventory and space, oversee sterilization department, and develop collaboration with the Supply Chain network.
Deploy and maintain Supply Chain Processes and Systems, focus on continuous improvement of material movement, propose and implement initiatives to optimize Supply Chain costs.
Provide leadership and direction for procurement savings goals, strategy and execution of inventory/working capital targets, and support Global Procurement initiatives.
Manage the overall logistical movement and control of finished goods, inbound and outbound materials, and inter-plant flows.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s Degree required in Logistics/Supply Chain Management, Business Administration, or Engineering. MBA Preferred
